introContent.text:
Introduction for Interactive Video.

(define what to put here, the viewer may need to click before the video can play.)

cueData.questionText:
So what do you think happened?
How did E. coli bacteria get into the cake?
cueData.questionInstructions: Choose one of the possible solutions to find the true culprit.
cueData.hintText: E. coli bacteria naturally occur in meat products, like raw pork sausage.

answers.answerText: An electric mixer spread germs from the sausage to the cake.
answers.feedbackText: Correct. E. coli bacteria naturally occur in meat products, like raw pork sausage. The bakery workers used the same mixer as the meat department employees.

answers.answerText: An employee didnâ€™t wash their hands after preparing pork sausage.
answers.feedbackText: Sorry. E. coli bacteria naturally occur in meat products, like raw pork sausage. Did you notice that the bakery workers used the same mixer as the meat department employees?

answers.answerText: The chocolate powder was contaminated by pests in the dry storage room.
answers.feedbackText: Sorry. E. coli bacteria naturally occur in meat products, like raw pork sausage. Did you notice that the bakery workers used the same mixer as the meat department employees?
